item.eventDesc:
Changes the value of a DM Tree node
The DIL can set the value of a DM Tree node to set the Server address or domain PIN. For example, Linux/QNX only.

eventVar.varDesc: Node format: chr, bool, int, bin

item.eventDesc:
Get the value of a DM Tree node
The DIL can get the value of a DM Tree node, such as the Server address or the domain PIN. For example, Linux/QNX only.
Reboot request failed.
The fully lock operation ended unsuccessfully.
The fully lock operation ended successfully.

varDesc.li: Determines whether a reboot is required

item.eventDesc: The unlock operation ended unsuccessfully.
The unlock operation ended successfully.

varDesc.li: Determines whether a reboot is required

item.eventDesc: The wipe data operation ended unsuccessfully.

The wipe data operation ended successfully.
A wipe data operation is considered a success even if a wipe was not done because the wipe data list was empty.
NOTE: The event is not sent from the Business Logic Layer in this version of the Software Management Client; this is a known limitation.
A request was made to modify the DM account data. Linux/QNX only.

eventVar.varDesc: WBXML string containing DM account data.

item.eventDesc: An NIA was received from the WAP Server. The Business Logic Layer checks whether to start a server-initiated session.

eventVar.varDesc: The message was extracted from the NIA.

item.eventDesc:
An NIA was received in a GCM. The Business Logic Layer checks whether to start a server-initiated session.
For an LAWMO or Purge Update notification, the Business Logic Layer cancels any current DM or Download session and stops any operation in-progress.

varDesc.li: 1: An LAWMO notification. NOTE: LAWMO unlock operations are currently marked as type 0 (regular).

item.eventDesc: Register the device's GCM registration ID. On failure, send DMA_MSG_NET_GCM_FAILED.
Unregistered the device from GCM. On failure, send DMA_MSG_NET_GCM_FAILED instead.
The end-user confirmed a download or an installation when prompted to confirm.
The end-user rejected a download in progress, or canceled a download when prompted to confirm.
The end-user confirmed postponement of a download or installation.
The timer set in DMA_MSG_SCOMO_SET_DL_TIMESLOT_DONE was triggered.
The end-user tapped the "Download Available" notification. See DMA_MSG_SCOMO_NOTIFY_DL_UI

When DMA_VAR_START_DM is "True", the end-user started the application and initiated a check for updates. The Business Logic Layer then checks whether to start a user-initiated session.
When DMA_VAR_START_DM is "False", the end-user started the application but did not initiate a check for updates.
The end-user requested enabling device polling (periodic, device-initiated sessions).
The end-user requested disabling device polling (periodic device-initiated sessions).
The end-user requested changing the device polling interval (periodic device-initiated sessions).

varDesc.li: Non-zero integer value: The number of hours between device polling attempts

item.eventDesc: The device's connection to a network has changed.
The device just now powered on.

The Client type
Sent during initialization.

varDesc.li: 1: The Dual Persona Client was installed (downloaded) by the end-user.
2: The Software Management Client was installed (downloaded) by the end-user.

item.eventDesc: The device's roaming status has changed.
A voice call started.
A voice call ended.
The device's connection to a Wi-Fi point has changed.
The end-user failed to respond to a UI alert within the time limit.
The end-user tapped OK on a screen. DMA_UI_ALERT_TYPE_INPUT is included when the end-user was asked to enter text on an Input screen.

eventVar.varDesc: Alert text (when the end-user was asked to enter text).

item.eventDesc: The end-user tapped Cancel on a screen.
The device is self-registering with the specified domain name and PIN.
The device is enrolling.
The configuration file could not be authenticated. Sent after a reboot requested by the Business Logic Layer.
The installation could not be performed. Sent after a reboot requested by the Business Logic Layer.

The battery level
Send in response to DMA_MSG_GET_BATTERY_LEVEL. In addition, send when the battery level exceeds the threshold if the device is waiting for a minimum battery level before it can continue with the installation.
The DIL set the timer to trigger at the next available time slot. Sent in response to DMA_MSG_SCOMO_SET_DL_TIMESLOT
A DESCMO operation completed.
An APK installation completed.
An APK uninstallation completed.
The GCM registration or unregistration failed. See DMA_MSG_NET_NOTIF_REGIST and DMA_MSG_NET_NOTIF_UNREGIST.
Sent in order to re-synchronize the status of the service between the Engine and DIL.

The value of a rule in the Rule Engine.
Send one of these events for each rule, in response to a single request (B2D_GET_ALL_CONDITIONS_VALUES) from the business logic. For more information, see "Checking Rules in the Rule Engine" in the Software Management Client Integrator's Guide.
Internal

An external installer installation has completed.
Send in response to B2D_MSG_SCOMO_EXTERNAL_INSTALL_REQUEST.

The installation has completed.
Sent in response to D2B_MSG_SCOMO_GENERIC_INSTALL_REQUEST or DMA_MSG_SCOMO_REBOOT_REQUEST.

The external storage configuration.
On each iteration, a chunk of the DP equal to DMA_VAR_BUFFER_SIZE is sent to the DIL to be written to external storage. Sent in response to B2D_GET_EXTERNAL_CONFIGURATION. For more information, see "External DPs" in the Software Management Client Integrator's Guide.

eventVar.varDesc: Maximum size of each DP part that can be handled on each iteration.
Maximum remaining space in external storage, if the download was interrupted.
Size of the DP already saved to external storage, if the download was interrupted.

item.eventDesc: Finished installing the components.
Post external download result (success/fail) to external download BL
Part of a DP was saved to external storage. Sent in response to B2D_BUFFER_READY. For more information, see "External DPs" in the Software Management Client Integrator's Guide.

Returns the installation type:
0: Internal installation
1: External DL and External installation
2: External installation In response, it sends D2B_SET_INSTALL_TYPE.
For more information, see "External DPs" in the Software Management Client Integrator's Guide.

An external installer installation completed update of the component.
Sent in response to B2D_MSG_SCOMO_EXTERNAL_INSTALL_REQUEST.

eventVar.varDesc: Provided by the server; determines the target environment needed to process or install the download package.
Notes whether the component is active.

item.eventDesc:
The DM Server proxy URL and the Download Server proxy URL.
A NULL string indicates no proxy URL is set. Sent in response to B2D_MSG_PROXY_CONFIGURATION_REQUEST. For more information, see "Dynamic Proxy Configuration" in the Software Management Client Integrator's Guide.
Started the unlock operation after user login
External connectivity status changed.
User restarted the download session. The new session might use a different connection method.
User starts get inventory to USB flow
User started USB update flow.

USB status
Sent in response to B2D_USBUPD_USB_STATUS_REQ

The car's vehicle identification number(VIN)
Sent in response to B2D_USBUPD_GET_VIN_REQ
The result of a DIL request to change a DM Tree node. Sent in response to D2B_MSG_TREE_NODE_REPLACE. Linux/QNX only.

eventVar.varDesc: Result: 0 on success, non-zero on failure

item.eventDesc: The result of a DIL request to get a DM Tree node. Sent in response to D2B_MSG_TREE_NODE_GET. Linux/QNX only.

eventVar.varDesc: Result: 0 on success, non-zero on failure
Node format: chr, bool, int, bin
VDM_ERR_OK on success, or a VDM_ERR_defs error code

item.eventDesc: Continue with the update flow. Sent after a FOTA update.
Reboot to the boot partition; currently used for LAWMO to reboot after lock/unlock
Displays a screen indicating that either there was a problem connecting to the server or the end-user canceled when trying to connect to the server.
DM session completed; another DM session can start. No action is required.

No update is available, or there is a DM session error. Displays a screen indicating:
No update was found.
Cannot check for updates while another session is in progress.
Could not trigger a check for updates, or the device was powered on while checking, or the end-user canceled the check while it was in progress.
Could not trigger a DM session while roaming.
Could not trigger a DM session because there is no network connection (for example, the device is in airplane mode).

eventVar.varDesc:
The error:
0x6382: General DM session error
0x6383: DM session network error
0x6384: No package found
0x6386: Device is roaming or is in emergency mode
0x6388: Another session is in progress
The messages to be displayed for failed conditions.

item.eventDesc: Display a screen indicating that there was an end-user interaction timeout.
Display a screen to the end-user that a DM session started.

A download failed. Display a screen indicating that, before or during a download:
The device is not within network range, or
The device is not within range of a Wi-Fi point and a Wi-Fi point is required, or
Another type of download error exists.

eventVar.varDesc:
DP size
This variable is fully compatible with single and multiple values, as required, uses 0x1F as the delimiter.
The number of this retry attempt

item.eventDesc: Register with Google Cloud messaging.
Unregistered with Google Cloud messaging.
Start a fully lock operation. When complete, send either DMA_MSG_LAWMO_LOCK_ENDED_FAILURE or DMA_MSG_LAWMO_LOCK_ENDED_SUCCESS.

eventVar.varDesc: Unlock password from server. Only relevant when the PwdFromServer node exists in the tree.xml and is equal to "True".

item.eventDesc: Displays a screen indicating that the fully lock operation failed.
Displays a screen indicating that the fully lock operation succeeded.
Starts an unlock operation. When complete, sends either DMA_MSG_LAWMO_UNLOCK_ENDED_FAILURE or DMA_MSG_LAWMO_UNLOCK_ENDED_SUCCESS.

eventVar.varDesc:
Did the server send the password?
0: False
1: True

item.eventDesc: Displays a screen indicating that the unlock operation failed.
Displays a screen indicating that the fully unlock operation succeeded.
Starts a wipe data operation. When complete, sends either DMA_MSG_LAWMO_WIPE_AGENT_ENDED_FAILURE or DMA_MSG_LAWMO_WIPE_AGENT_ENDED_SUCCESS.

eventVar.varDesc: The list of items to wipe.

item.eventDesc: Displays a screen indicating that the wipe data operation failed.
Displays a screen indicating that the wipe data operation was not performed.
Displays a screen indicating that the wipe data operation succeeded.
Displays a screen indicating that the end-user rejected a download in progress or canceled a download when prompted to confirm.

An update is available. Displays a screen to prompt the end-user to confirm a download. If postpone is enabled, displays a "Later" button.
Returns the end-user's response to the confirm screen, either DMA_MSG_SCOMO_ACCEPT, DMA_MSG_SCOMO_CANCEL, or DMA_MSG_SCOMO_POSTPONE. If a silent update, returns DMA_MSG_SCOMO_ACCEPT without displaying a screen.

eventVar.varDesc:
DP size
This variable is fully compatible with single and multiple values, as required, uses 0x1F as the delimiter.

varDesc.p:
URL of the release notes.
To display the release notes, the client can use an HTTP GET on this URL, with the following optional parameters:
Locale=[locale-string]: The locale of the page to display.
Type=HTML: Asks for an HTML response. HTML can be displayed using the device's build-in browser.
Type=XML: Asks for an XML response. XML can be formatted with any additional information added as required.

eventVar.varDesc: Parameters to pass to the installer.
The UIInfo XML tag maintains all information needed to present the component selection UI to the user.

Provided by the server; determines the target environment needed to process or install the download package.
This variable is fully compatible with single and multiple values, as required, uses 0x1F as the delimiter.

Update file ID
This variable is fully compatible with single and multiple values, as required, uses 0x1F as the delimiter.

Update file Version
This variable is fully compatible with single and multiple values, as required, uses 0x1F as the delimiter.

Update file name
This variable is fully compatible with single and multiple values, as required, uses 0x1F as the delimiter.

item.eventDesc: Displays a screen indicating that the download is starting. The DIL can return DMA_MSG_USER_CANCEL if the end-user cancels the download.
Download started
Displays a screen showing download progress. The DIL can return DMA_MSG_USER_CANCEL if the end-user cancels the download.

eventVar.varDesc:
DP size
This variable is fully compatible with single and multiple values, as required, uses 0x1F as the delimiter.

item.eventDesc: Displays a screen indicating the download has been suspended.

eventVar.varDesc: Number of seconds that the download is suspended

item.eventDesc: Displays a screen indicating that the download will occur during the time slot set by the server.

eventVar.varDesc: Number of seconds that the download is suspended

item.eventDesc:
An update was downloaded and is ready to install. Displays a screen to prompt the end-user to confirm the installation. The screen does not provide an option to cancel the installation.
Returns the end-user's response to the confirm screen, either DMA_MSG_SCOMO_ACCEPT, DMA_MSG_SCOMO_CANCEL, or DMA_MSG_SCOMO_POSTPONE. If a silent update, return DMA_MSG_SCOMO_ACCEPT without displaying a screen.

eventVar.varDesc:
URL of the release notes
This variable is fully compatible with single and multiple values, as required, uses 0x1F as the delimiter.
The UIInfo XML tag maintains all information needed to present the component selection UI to the user.

Provided by the server; determines the target environment needed to process or install the download package.
This variable is fully compatible with single and multiple values, as required; uses 0x1F as the delimiter.

item.eventDesc:
Displays a screen indicating that the end-user must charge the battery.
Sent when the battery level is not above or equal to the threshold and this is not a silent update.
When the battery level exceeds the threshold, sends DMA_MSG_BATTERY_LEVEL.

eventVar.varDesc: The minimum threshold, in percent, that is required for the installation to resume.

item.eventDesc: Displays a screen indicating the postpone status.
Displays a screen indicating that an installation has completed.

varDesc.li: 1457: Update cannot be read from the USB

item.eventDesc: Displays a screen indicating the installation progress.

eventVar.varDesc:
DP size
This variable is fully compatible with single and multiple values, as required; uses 0x1F as the delimiter.
The UIInfo XML tag maintains all information needed to present the component selection UI to the user.

Provided by the server; determines the target environment needed to process or install the download package.
This variable is fully compatible with single and multiple values, as required, uses 0x1F as the delimiter.

item.eventDesc:
Displays a notification indicating that an update is available to download and install. The update was initiated by the device/server.
If the DIL is ready to receive more information about the available download (for example, the DIL doesn't support notifications, or after the end-user taps the notification), returns DMA_MSG_SCOMO_NOTIFY_DL.

eventVar.varDesc:
URL of the release notes
This variable is fully compatible with single and multiple values, as required, uses 0x1F as the delimiter.
The UIInfo XML tag maintains all information needed to present the component selection UI to the user.

Provided by the server; determines the target environment needed to process or install the download package.
This variable is fully compatible with single and multiple values, as required, uses 0x1F as the delimiter.

Update file ID
This variable is fully compatible with single and multiple values, as required, uses 0x1F as the delimiter.

Update file Version
This variable is fully compatible with single and multiple values, as required, uses 0x1F as the delimiter.

Update file name
This variable is fully compatible with single and multiple values, as required, uses 0x1F as the delimiter.

item.eventDesc: Reboots the device. Displays a screen indicating that the update will continue after reboot. For more information on installer types, see "Installer Types" in the Software Management Client Integrator's Guide.

eventVar.varDesc: The installer types for all software, separated by ";"s. Can be used by the generic reboot installer.
The components' paths, separated by ";"s. Can be used by the generic reboot installer.
If the variable exists, it contains the signed configuration zip file name that is passed to GOTA.
If the variable exists, it contains the path to the signed configuration zip file that is passed to GOTA.

item.eventDesc:
Displays a screen asking the end-user if the device can reboot.
Returns the end-user's response, either DMA_MSG_USER_ACCEPT or DMA_MSG_USER_CANCEL.

eventVar.varDesc: The installer types for all software, separated by "/"s. Can be used by the generic reboot installer.
The components' paths, separated by ";"s. Can be used by the generic reboot installer.

item.eventDesc: A download is complete. Displays a notification that the download has completed.

Displays a screen to the end-user:
Information (OK button only)
Confirmation (OK and Cancel)
Text input (Input field, OK, and Cancel)
Selection (Single or multiple options, OK, and Cancel)
All screens include informational text and a minimum and maximum time for display.
The confirmation screen includes a default selection.
The text input screen has a default text, indicates data and echo types and has a maximum length.
The selection screen has default selections and indicates whether multiple options may be selected.
If the end-user taps OK, sends DMA_MSG_SCOMO_ACCEPT. If the end-user taps Cancel, sends DMA_MSG_SCOMO_CANCEL. If the alert times out without a response, sends D2B_UI_ALERT_TIMEOUT.

eventVar.varDesc: Minimum time to display alert (if end-user does not close it)
Confirmation screen: Default response: 0 is Cancel, 1 is OK
Input screen: Maximum length of text response
Input screen: Type of text response: text, date, email, etc
Input screen: 0 - echos response text, 1 - masks response text
Selection screen: 0 - Only one selection permitted, 1 - Multiple selections permitted

item.eventDesc: Displays a screen indicating that the device is checking for new updates. Sent after the end-user triggered a new DM session.

eventVar.varDesc: 0: Displays a message indicating that the device is checking for updates. 1: Displays a message indicating that the device is initializing.

item.eventDesc: Returns the current battery level by sending DMA_MSG_BATTERY_LEVEL.

eventVar.varDesc: Whether the update is user-initiated. For internal use.

item.eventDesc: Sets the timer indicating the time (in seconds) before starting the download. After setting the timer, sends DMA_MSG_SCOMO_SET_DL_TIMESLOT_DONE. When the timer triggers, sends DMA_MSG_DL_TIMESLOT_TIMEOUT.

eventVar.varDesc: The number of seconds before the download starts

item.eventDesc: Internal
Internal
Internal
Installs an APK. When complete, sends the event DMA_MSG_SCOMO_INSTALL_COMP_RESULT.
Uninstalls an APK. When complete, sends the event DMA_MSG_SCOMO_REMOVE_COMP_RESULT.
Cancels a request to install or uninstall an APK. Typically sent as a result of a timeout.
Internal: Create bookmark on desktop
Internal: Remove bookmark from desktop
A download/install flow has ended successfully or unsuccessfully. A new session cannot start until this event is received.
Sends Domain Name to DIL
Internal: vSense service server address
Internal: vSense service domain name, server address, polling interval
Internal: vSense service polling interval

Returns all rules from the Rule Engine by sending a series of D2B_CONDITION_VALUE_UPDATE events. For more information, see "Checking Rules in the Rule Engine" in the Software Management Client Integrator's Guide.
Internal
If DMA_VAR_CONDITIONS_MET is 0, send DMA_MSG_SCOMO_ACCEPT to continue with the installation. Otherwise display the Rule Engine screen.

varDesc.li: 0: At least one condition is not met.

eventVar.varDesc: The messages to display for failed rule.
Parameters to pass to the installer.

item.eventDesc:
Installs software using the external installer
When finished, sends D2B_MSG_SCOMO_EXTERNAL_INSTALL_RESULT or D2B_MSG_SCOMO_EXTERNAL_INSTALL_DC_RESULT.

eventVar.varDesc:
The Update-package name
This variable is fully compatible with single and multiple values, as required, uses 0x1F as the delimiter.

item.eventDesc:
Installs software using the generic installer
When finished, sends D2B_MSG_SCOMO_INSTALL_RESULT.

eventVar.varDesc:
The installation type:
1: Install
2: Update
3: Remove
Offset of software within the DP
Length of software within the DP
Installer ID to use for the installation. For more information see "Installer Types" in the Software Management Client Integrator's Guide.

item.eventDesc:
Stores the buffer (part of a DP) to external storage. In response, sends D2B_BUFFER_TRANSMITTED.
For more information, see "External DPs" in the Software Management Client Integrator's Guide.

eventVar.varDesc: The offset of the buffer in the DP.

item.eventDesc:
Sends information about external DP handling. In response, sends D2B_SET_EXTERNAL_CONFIGURATION.
For more information, see "External DPs" in the Software Management Client Integrator's Guide.

Returns the installation type: 0 - Internal; 1 - External. In response, sends D2B_SET_INSTALL_TYPE.
For more information, see "External DPs" in the Software Management Client Integrator's Guide.

eventVar.varDesc: A list of installer types of the components to be updated/installed. The list is comma separated and is located within the XML "InstallerType" tags, e.g.,<InstallerType>10,11,9</InstallerType>

item.eventDesc:
Returns the DM Server proxy URL and the Download Server proxy URL by sending D2B_MSG_PROXY_CONFIGURATION_RESPONSE.
This event is sent only if the configuration parameter "dynamic_config_proxy" is set to "True". For more information, see "Configuring DM Client Parameters" in the Software Management Client Integrator's Guide.
The hardware synchronization process has ended and DM sessions are allowed. DM Sessions cannot start before this event is received.
Starts the HTML5 Client.
Notifies the DIL to register or unregister in response to the user login broadcast
Request for USB status
Update preparation succeeded, the user can now disconnect the USB.
Update preparation failed.
Sent to the application upon failure to extract the update (malformed or inaccessible).
Report completed.
Report to USB.
Request for VIN (Vehicle Identification Number)
USB connect request
Download started; is using an external device
Download is in progress; is using an external device. Received in response to DMA_MSG_USER_SESSION_TRIGGERED during external download.
Dowload is time out; is using an external device
Download is in progress. Received in response to DMA_MSG_USER_SESSION_TRIGGERED during download.
Boot start failed
